sense.name: a frame of mind, an interpretation
sense.examples: What is John's perspective on the Patriot Act? Most guidebook history is written from the editor's perspective. After the last meeting, Mary is finally coming around to our perspective of Bob. From their perspective we appear to be the aggressors.

sense.name: a view of objects from a certain position
sense.examples: From this perspective, the mirror seems to be hanging a bit crooked. This perspective of the house shows off its nice landscaped backyard. They are trying to gain a broader perspective of the international scene. (figurative extension) We need to keep these smaller issues in their proper perspective. (figurative extension) We need to keep a sense of perspective on what he has done. (figuratively implies a desired location)

sense.name: a drawing technique to represent 3D in 2D
sense.examples: Many ancient cultures did not use perspective in their drawings. This artist works in both perspective and purely abstract forms on her canvases. Having the lines converge at the horizon will add perspective to your drawing.
